Title: Linux Installer builder
Body: Set of scripts and support files that allows the creation of a .deb installer for Debian-based systems (Ubuntu  Mint  etc).

Title: Linux Packager various fixes
Body: A number of little bugs fixed: -Using the correct license file -Menu shortcut now uses APMPlanner icon -A couple of typos and permissions issues fixed

Title: qmake install now works in Linux
Body: Running "qmake install" will build APM Planner and install it on the user's system.   Using the PREFIX=/some_dir/usr in the command will tell qmake to install APM Planner in the specified directory (default is /usr).

Title: Linux Forced usage of libudev for serial ports Also minor build fixes
Body: Forced usage of libudev in APMSerial  as it's the only reliable port detection method. Should fix #168  Minor cleanup of build files  including proper version labeling in deb file creation.

Title: Linux Autobuild now working via pbuilder
Body: The Linux branch can be build by pbuilder  pdebuild  etc

Title: Map Widget Add support for ArcGIS World Topo maps
Body: Addresses #386

Title: qmake install now working under Linux
Body: Running "qmake install" will build APM Planner and install it on the user's system.  Using the PREFIX=/some_dir/usr in the command will tell qmake to install APM Planner in the specified directory (default is /usr).  (edit on pull request #93 to correct package name to "APM Planner 2" rather than "APM Planner")

Title: Google Hybrid maps fixed
Body: Updated OpMapControl to be compatible with new version of Google Maps.  Fixes issues #26 and #98.

Title: Added norwegian topographic maps
Body: The highest quality maps available for norwegian UAV operators. - can anyone please tell my why I see 14 commits  when I wanted to change only 4 files with one commit  ?  - somehow I fail to see how to deselect the other commits.

Title: Bugfix missing updates PrimaryFlightDisplay now connecting to UASCreated and UASDeleted signals
Pixhawk MavLink Updated
Body: I am not actually sure about the function of this file  for example  a mission conaining  82 were transferred correctly before update too. -Anyway - now it's updated to current version.

Title: Widget Joystick
Body: Revive joystick code -- more of a re-implementation really. See #144.  Configure your joystick through the joystick menu. Activate the joystick (so it sends events to the UAS) by clicking on the joystick name.  If the UAS is a multi-rotor in stabilize mode  the joystick controls are sent as RC overrides  otherwise if the UAS is in manual mode the joystick controls are sent as manual controls.

Title: Spec file and scripts to build RPM
Body: scripts/prepare_rpm.pl - pulls latest updates from repo  creates source tarball and updates spec-file scripts/build_rpm.sh - builds RPM package redhat/apmplanner2.spec - spec-file template

Title: Spec file and scripts to build RPM
Body: scripts/prepare_rpm.pl - pulls latest updates from repo  creates source tarball and updates spec-file scripts/build_rpm.sh - builds RPM package redhat/apmplanner2.spec - spec-file template

Title: Linux removed extraneous paths and QT4 reference
Body: Removed extraneous build path reference. Also removed QT4 from autobuild script. Thanks to @gmorph for spotting it

Title: Plan View tooltip no longer adds MSL to any altitude
Body: The WP tooltip said that any altitude were an MSL altitude  regardless of the wp being relative to home_alt. This could be dangerous if certain plan types were verified based on tooltip. I tried to add conditional string  but did not find how to get altitude-type.

Title: Yum repository support
Body: I've added configs to support Yum repository for RedHat-based distros. So  if anyone is pllanning on deploying APM Planner 2 this configs would help.  yum install http://www.froller.net/diydrones/noarch/diydrones-repo-1-1.noarch.rpm yum install apmplanner2  when the update would be available:  yum update apmplanner2

Title: Map Widget Fixes 701 Add auto map caching option
Body: Add option when caching maps to auto continue to a desired zoom level. Form allows for both single level and multi-level caching and prompts user at the end of either caching session to stop or continue. Desired zoom level can be changed at any time (unless user prompt is displayed) and will stop at or continue to new desired level.   ![map1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8054027/8552334/71b94dfe-24aa-11e5-8561-34c68c86178a.png)  ![map2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8054027/8552336/7539927c-24aa-11e5-8f30-d720545b3710.png)  ![map3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8054027/8552338/77a4e4bc-24aa-11e5-95f1-fa9b051560c2.png)

Title: Update MAVLink library for APM 3 3
Body: APM 3.3 introduced new useful mavlink messages such as PID_TUNING  VIBRATION  EKF_STATUS_REPORT. Update mavlink version  so this data could be seen in mavlink inspector widget and graphs.

Title: UI Framework Enable use of Network Proxies
Body: Fixes Issue #551 Add support for downloading behind a proxy server  Enable the use of QNetworkProxyFactory to automatically detect and use Network Proxies. This allows the downloading of map data when behind a firewall.  Functionality can be disabled by setting environment variable   IGNORE_PROXY

Title: Map improvements
Body: Some map/ mission widget improvements and fix for issue #691

Title: Fix compiler warnings
Body: Fixed most of the compiler warnings occurred on my Ubuntu 14.04 using Qt 5.3.0  Fixes issue #40

Title: Valgrind fixes
Body: As I mentioned in #941 I have done several valgrind runs. These are the fixes for several issues valgrind complained about. Perhaps it makes APM Planner a bit more stable but those fixes won't help for #941 I think. Anyhow I somebody likes to test - feel free :smiley:

Title: QsLog and valgrind
Body: Here is my new PR. Picked the important changes from old PR #944 and added the redefinition of the QsLog macros. This should workaround the QsLog issue #941. The other commits fix some valgrind issues  a memleak and a race condition.

Title: Several Fixes
Body: A new PR is born :smiley:   I have made several fixes for the following issues:   * #1019 - FlightPlan:multiple waypoints are moving together after load.   * #1022 - Graph: .BIN Logs made with GPXS   GRXH  EKF5 causing slow performance and lots of errors.    * #1023 - Graph: where did "filter" go ?    * #1024 - Plan/Flight data   orphaned lines between waypoints.

Title: Updated shellscript to make console output visible
Several Bug fixes
Body: After fixing the bug made in last PR here is the replacement for #1025     Here is the list of what have been fixed:   * #1019 - FlightPlan:multiple waypoints are moving together after load.   * #1022 - Graph: .BIN Logs made with GPXS   GRXH  EKF5 causing slow performance and lots of errors.    * #1023 - Graph: where did "filter" go ?    * #1024 - Plan/Flight data   orphaned lines between waypoints.    I hope this time nobody finds a bug :smiley:

Title: RPM building scripts and assets updated
Body: - prepare_rpm rewritten in bash instead of Perl - .spec-file fixed to build on Fedora 24 - build-time patch added to avoid errors on RedHat-based distros

Title: Build Refactor docker directory create update Dockerfiles
Body: The previous Dockerfile was outdated: the URL to download the firmware was not valid anymore.  This pull request will fix that. In addition  I think that  instead of constantly updating the Dockerfile each time a new release is made  we could refactor the directory 'docker' to contain all the Dockerfiles that have been created for previous and current releases. To this end  we create a sub-directory named "release-distribution" that contains the Dockerfile for the specific release of apmplanner2 and the linux distribution.    In anycase  I think that the best would be to use dockerhub to distribute pre-built images of apmplanner2.

Title: Maps Update urls to get GoogleVersion
build cleanups and bugfixes
Body: - introduce a build-time test for flite support to determine if a   compatible version of flite is installed - remove duplicate code from apm_planner.pro - correct spelling of redhat-release in apm_planner.pro - make installation of debian menu files only happen on debian/ubuntu   environments - move sik firmware into /usr/share

Title: Some small fixes in opmapcontrol
Body: While using the opmapcontrol lib in another project I came across some issues like memory leaks and deprecated project files. The committed changes fix those.

Title: Flightplan Introduced GraphicsItem base class for graphics items on map
Body: Follow-up pull request to PR #1083 .    The commit introduces a new GraphicsItem base class for 1st-level child graphics items shown on the map (currently: GPSItem  HomeItem  UAVItem  WaypointItem). This approach allows an easy extension of the items and avoids duplicated code.    I struggled a bit with [mapgraphicitem.cpp:125](https://github.com/ArduPilot/apm_planner/pull/1085/files#diff-4ca69cb6bc9197e2f5d3734df23ca9acL125): Does it make sense to emit the mapChanged() signal after each item having updated its position or would it be sufficient to emit this signal once after all positions are updated?

Title: Mavlink2 migration
Body: Changed mavlink library to version 2.0 and adapted code base.  I hope I found all parts which had to be adapted.    If anybody wants to review just review the second commit as the first one is mainly the library replacement.

Title: Build Fedora 26 build scripts and spec files
New Gps trail Feature
Body: Hi all     after a long time I decided to develop a new cool feature for the log analysis feature of the APM-Planner.  We do now support showing the GPS Trail of a logged flight. The feature looks like this:  ![Screenshot_20190428_135518](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7621911/56864282-f06fb200-69c0-11e9-8606-0c544028247c.png)    There is a new menu entry called View in the log analysis window. It will open the new window showing the trail and an multicopter icon representing the current position. The Icon moves on the trail when you enable and move the table cursor in the graph.    I hope you like it :smile:

Title: map Added Japan Map
Body: I live in Japan.  I have many mountainous areas in Japan.  I want to use a map with elevations.  I want to be able to use the map of the Geographical Survey Institute of Japan.    ![Screenshot from 2019-07-28 21-10-46](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/646194/62006777-44d12c00-b180-11e9-9cf9-97c829722d08.png)
